Package danogl.gui

Interface UserInputListener

public interface UserInputListener
An interface for reading user input in the current frame

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Vector2 getMouseScreenPos()
    Returns the mouse's coordinates in the standard danogl coordinate system, i.e.
    boolean isKeyPressed​(int keyFromKeyEvent)
    Returns whether a key is currently down.
    boolean isMouseButtonPressed​(MouseButton button)
    Returns whether a mouse button is currently down/depressed/pressed.
    double mouseWheelClicksThisFrame()
    Returns the number of clicks the mousewheel was rotated this frame.
    boolean wasKeyReleasedThisFrame​(int keyFromKeyEvent)
    Returns whether a given key was just released.
    boolean wasMouseButtonClickedThisFrame​(MouseButton button)
    Returns whether a given mouse button was just clicked (pressed and released shortly afterwards).

  • Method Details

    • isKeyPressed

      boolean isKeyPressed​(int keyFromKeyEvent)
      Returns whether a key is currently down. This method will return true for a given key as long as it is pressed (i.e. from the frame in which the key was held down until the frame in which the key was released).
      Parameters:
      keyFromKeyEvent - a key code from the class KeyEvent (KeyEvent.VK_...)
      Returns:
      is the specified key held down in the current frame

    • wasKeyReleasedThisFrame

      boolean wasKeyReleasedThisFrame​(int keyFromKeyEvent)
      Returns whether a given key was just released. This method returns true for a key only in the frame in which it was released.
      Parameters:
      keyFromKeyEvent - a key code from the class KeyEvent (KeyEvent.VK_...)
      Returns:
      was the specified key released in this frame

    • wasMouseButtonClickedThisFrame

      boolean wasMouseButtonClickedThisFrame​(MouseButton button)
      Returns whether a given mouse button was just clicked (pressed and released shortly afterwards). This method returns true for a button only in the frame in which it was clicked.
      Parameters:
      button - the queried mouse button
      Returns:
      was the specified button released in this frame

    • isMouseButtonPressed

      boolean isMouseButtonPressed​(MouseButton button)
      Returns whether a mouse button is currently down/depressed/pressed.
      Parameters:
      button - the queried mouse button
      Returns:
      is the specified button down in this frame

    • getMouseScreenPos

      Vector2 getMouseScreenPos()
      Returns the mouse's coordinates in the standard danogl coordinate system, i.e. in pixels, where the top-left pixel is (0,0). This is relative to the screen, i.e., window. If a camera is used and you need the mouse's position in world coordinates, use the camera's transformation method screenToWorldCoords.

    • mouseWheelClicksThisFrame

      double mouseWheelClicksThisFrame()
      Returns the number of clicks the mousewheel was rotated this frame.
      Returns:
      negative values for scrolling up, positive for scrolling down.
